program codeforces_134_A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, i, sum_total, c
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, indices

    read(*,*) n

    if (n ==0) then
        write(*,*) 0
        write(*,*) ""
        stop
    end if

Program structure:

1. Read n.

2. Read n numbers into an array.

3. Compute their sum.

4. Iterate through each element, compute temp, check the conditions.

5. Collect indices in an array.

Then output count and indices.

Also, the code must allocate arrays, etc.

Here's the code in Fortran 90:

program codeforces_134_A

    implicit none

    integer :: n, i, sum_total, c
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, indices

    read(*,*) n

    if (n ==0) then
        write(*,*) 0
        write(*,*) ""
        stop
    end if

    allocate( arr(1:n), indices(1:n) )
    c =0

    read(*,*) (arr(i), i=1,n)

    sum_total = sum( arr )

    do i=1,n
        if ( (n-1) ==0 ) cycle  ! skip when n=1, since n-1=0, which would cause division by zero
        if (mod( sum_total - arr(i), n-1 ) == 0 ) then
            if ( ( (sum_total - arr(i)) / (n-1) ) == arr(i) ) then
                c = c +1
                indices(c) = i
            end if
        end if
    end do

    write(*,*) c
    if (c >0 ) then
        write(*,*) (indices(j), j=1,c)
    else
        write(*,*)  ! empty line
    end if

    deallocate(arr, indices)
end program codeforces_134_A
